1. How does the real-life teacher differ from the teacher in the photo?

The teacher in the photo is smaller than the real-life teacher. But the ratio between the height of the teacher in the photo and the height of the magazine in the photo is the same as the ratio between the height of the real-life teacher and the height of the real-life magazine.
If we cut the hat from the photo and put it on our head, it would be ridiculously small. We would need to scale-up the size of the hat to get it to fit.
2. Can you think of some other times you could use a photo to estimate the size of something?

• You might want to use a photograph to estimate the size of a large item you plan to buy, such as a large bookshelf. Estimating its size can help you determine whether or not it will fit in its designated spot.
  • You could also take a close-up shot of something small, like an insect, next to an object with a standard size, like a penny. Then you can compare the features of the insect, such as its size, to pictures in a reference book.
